flawed_nl_solution:
3/4 of the water tank is 3/4*4000 = <<3/4*4000=16000/3>>16000/3
If the pipe fills the tank with water at the rate of 10 gallons per hour, it will take 16000/3/10 = <<16000/3/10=1600/3>>1600/3 hours to fill the tank to 3/4 of its capacity
#### 1600/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3000, not 16000/3. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
